description: Describes the orderable DB instance options for a specified DB engine.

parameters.name: Engine
parameters.description: The name of the database engine to describe DB instance options for. Valid Values: aurora-mysql aurora-postgresql custom-oracle-ee custom-oracle-ee-cdb custom-oracle-se2 custom-oracle-se2-cdb db2-ae db2-se mariadb mysql oracle-ee oracle-ee-cdb oracle-se2 oracle-se2-cdb postgres sqlserver-ee sqlserver-se sqlserver-ex sqlserver-web.

parameters.name: LicenseModel
parameters.description: A filter to include only the available options for the specified license model. RDS Custom supports only the BYOL licensing model.

parameters.name: AvailabilityZoneGroup
parameters.description: The Availability Zone group associated with a Local Zone. Specify this parameter to retrieve available options for the Local Zones in the group. Omit this parameter to show the available options in the specified Amazon Web Services Region. This setting doesn't apply to RDS Custom DB instances.

parameters.name: Vpc
parameters.description: Specifies whether to show only VPC or non-VPC offerings. RDS Custom supports only VPC offerings. If you describe non-VPC offerings for RDS Custom, the output shows VPC offerings.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: This parameter isn't currently supported. (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as IDs. The filters supported by a describe operation are documented with the describe operation. The following actions can be filtered: DescribeDBClusterBacktracks DescribeDBClusterEndpoints DescribeDBClusters DescribeDBInstances DescribeDBRecommendations DescribeDBShardGroups DescribePendingMaintenanceActions The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. One or more filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. (string) ---

parameters.name: MaxRecords
parameters.description: The maximum number of records to include in the response. If more records exist than the specified MaxRecords value, a pagination token called a marker is included in the response so that you can retrieve the remaining results. Default: 100 Constraints: Minimum 20, maximum 1000.

nested_items.name: OrderableDBInstanceOptions
nested_items.description: An OrderableDBInstanceOption structure containing information about orderable options for the DB instance.

nested_items.name: Engine
nested_items.description: The engine type of a DB instance.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: The engine version of a DB instance.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceClass
nested_items.description: The DB instance class for a DB instance.

nested_items.name: LicenseModel
nested_items.description: The license model for a DB instance.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZoneGroup
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone group for a DB instance.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZones
nested_items.description: A list of Availability Zones for a DB instance.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the Availability Zone.

nested_items.name: MultiAZCapable
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a DB instance is Multi-AZ capable.

nested_items.name: ReadReplicaCapable
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a DB instance can have a read replica.

nested_items.name: Vpc
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a DB instance is in a VPC.

nested_items.name: SupportsStorageEncryption
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a DB instance supports encrypted storage.

nested_items.name: StorageType
nested_items.description: The storage type for a DB instance.

nested_items.name: SupportsIops
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a DB instance supports provisioned IOPS.

nested_items.name: SupportsEnhancedMonitoring
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a DB instance supports Enhanced Monitoring at intervals from 1 to 60 seconds.

nested_items.name: SupportsIAMDatabaseAuthentication
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a DB instance supports IAM database authentication.

nested_items.name: SupportsPerformanceInsights
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a DB instance supports Performance Insights.

nested_items.name: MinStorageSize
nested_items.description: Minimum storage size for a DB instance.

nested_items.name: MaxStorageSize
nested_items.description: Maximum storage size for a DB instance.

nested_items.name: MinIopsPerDbInstance
nested_items.description: Minimum total provisioned IOPS for a DB instance.

nested_items.name: MaxIopsPerDbInstance
nested_items.description: Maximum total provisioned IOPS for a DB instance.

nested_items.name: MinIopsPerGib
nested_items.description: Minimum provisioned IOPS per GiB for a DB instance.

nested_items.name: MaxIopsPerGib
nested_items.description: Maximum provisioned IOPS per GiB for a DB instance.

nested_items.name: AvailableProcessorFeatures
nested_items.description: A list of the available processor features for the DB instance class of a DB instance.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the processor feature. Valid names are coreCount and threadsPerCore.

nested_items.name: DefaultValue
nested_items.description: The default value for the processor feature of the DB instance class.

nested_items.name: AllowedValues
nested_items.description: The allowed values for the processor feature of the DB instance class.

nested_items.name: SupportedEngineModes
nested_items.description: A list of the supported DB engine modes.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SupportsStorageAutoscaling
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Amazon RDS can automatically scale storage for DB instances that use the specified DB instance class.

nested_items.name: SupportsKerberosAuthentication
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a DB instance supports Kerberos Authentication.

nested_items.name: OutpostCapable
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a DB instance supports RDS on Outposts.

nested_items.name: SupportedActivityStreamModes
nested_items.description: The list of supported modes for Database Activity Streams. Aurora PostgreSQL returns the value [sync, async]. Aurora MySQL and RDS for Oracle return [async] only. If Database Activity Streams isn't supported, the return value is an empty list.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SupportsGlobalDatabases
nested_items.description: Indicates whether you can use Aurora global databases with a specific combination of other DB engine attributes.

nested_items.name: SupportsClusters
nested_items.description: Indicates whether DB instances can be configured as a Multi-AZ DB cluster.

nested_items.name: SupportedNetworkTypes
nested_items.description: The network types supported by the DB instance ( IPV4 or DUAL).
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SupportsStorageThroughput
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a DB instance supports storage throughput.

nested_items.name: MinStorageThroughputPerDbInstance
nested_items.description: Minimum storage throughput for a DB instance.

nested_items.name: MaxStorageThroughputPerDbInstance
nested_items.description: Maximum storage throughput for a DB instance.

nested_items.name: MinStorageThroughputPerIops
nested_items.description: Minimum storage throughput to provisioned IOPS ratio for a DB instance.

nested_items.name: MaxStorageThroughputPerIops
nested_items.description: Maximum storage throughput to provisioned IOPS ratio for a DB instance.

nested_items.name: SupportsDedicatedLogVolume
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a DB instance supports using a dedicated log volume (DLV).

nested_items.name: Marker
nested_items.description: An optional pagination token provided by a previous OrderableDBInstanceOptions request. If this parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the marker, up to the value specified by MaxRecords.
